title: Eloquent JavaScript
author: Marijn Haverbeke
description: This is a book about JavaScript, programming, and the wonders of the digital.

title: Think Python
author: Allen Downey
description: Think Python is an introduction to Python programming for beginners. It starts with basic concepts of programming, and is carefully designed to define all terms when they are first used and to develop each new concept in a logical progression.

title: Automate the Boring Stuff
author: Al Sweigart
description: In Automate the Boring Stuff with Python, you'll learn how to use Python to write programs that do in minutes what would take you hours to do by hand-no prior programming experience required.

title: Coding With Minecraft
author: Al Sweigart
description: In Coding with Minecraft, you'll create a virtual robot army with Lua, a programming language used by professional game developers. Step-by-step coding projects will show you how to write programs that automatically dig mines, collect materials, craft items, and build anything that you can imagine. Along the way, you'll explore key computer science concepts like data types, functions, variables, and more.

title: Learn Enough Command Line to Be Dangerous
author: Michael Hartl
description: Learn Enough Command Line to Be Dangerous is an introduction to the command line for complete beginners, the first in a series of tutorials designed to teach the common foundations of computer magic to as broad an audience as possible. It is aimed both at those who work with software developers and those who aspire to become developers themselves.

title: Obey the Testing Goat
author: Harry Percival
description: Test Django effectively using Selenium. The goat is not explained.
